meanings.sent1: She was reinking her drawing to make it brighter.
meanings.sent2: The printer needed reinking to produce clear documents.
meanings.sent3: The artist kept reinking the same spot, creating a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: The pen seemed to be reinking the paper with endless creativity.
meanings.sent5: Reinking the tattoo made the design pop with vibrant colors.

meanings.sent1: The reinking of the document was necessary for legibility.
meanings.sent2: His job at the printing shop involved reinking old newspapers.
meanings.sent3: The reinking process was tedious but essential for quality prints.
meanings.sent4: Her reinking of the artwork brought out new details in the design.
meanings.sent5: The reinking of the tattoo added depth and richness to the image.
